summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI personnel discussing the status of victim outreach and services offered to victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It details the number of victims contacted in New York and Miami, the types of services offered, and coordination efforts for upcoming hearings.

persons.name: FBI New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails coordinating victim outreach and requesting updates for the Significant Activity Report (SAR).

events.title: Upcoming hearing for Epstein case
events.description: Mentioned as a date for which victims were being updated about an upcoming hearing.

events.title: Victim outreach status update
events.description: An update was provided stating that 24 victims had been spoken to and offered services (17 in New York, 7 in Miami), with efforts ongoing for 5 more.

events.title: Continued victim outreach coordination
events.description: The email author states they are in the process of calling 31 victims not represented by counsel to offer services and provide updates, and had met with one NY victim in person earlier in the week.

keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, the FBI's Victim Services Division had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims of Jeffrey Epstein (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, media information, and counseling referrals.
As of August 22, 2019, outreach was ongoing to 31 victims not represented by legal counsel, with coordination for services for 5 additional victims.
The document establishes a weekly reporting requirement (Significant Activity Report - SAR) to track victim outreach and service provision in the Epstein case.
